column5: Arrived up in Port Perry at about 7 o'clock, get set up before 7 30.  Started drilling holes all around until I finally found one that was producing a steady line of perch.  I was able to stay on the same hole for about 2.5 hours, catching perch quite steadily, and even kept 7 to take home.  I was hoping and hoping for an eye or two to show up, but no luck.  The temperature had risen from 14 to 35 in a matter of 4-5 hours!  All in all, it was a enjoyable day.
Also, all fish were taken on an orange hauger spoon.  The cheap tape was peeling off by the end of the day, and this was the first trip I had used it.
Good report and great pic of fat fish!!!  I kinda like it when the fish tear up one of my lures!
those are some chunky looking perch.
Yeah, it definitely puts a lot confidence in that one bait. I just cleaned all those perch, and every single one was female and full of eggs.
Nice looking jumbo. Did you see anyone catch crappie? BTW, I think you need to adjust the dates on your camera.

It's an old camera, I didn't want to take the new one outside in the rain  . I've heard lots about crappie getting caught, but I've yet to even see one personally. I wish I did, they can fight really good.

during daylight hours the only thing i've caught on Scugog is Perch and LM Bass, actually i did get 1 Walleye. Although most Walleye and Crappies are caught as the sun is going down, or right into the night.  Good job on those Perch. There are a lot of 10-12 inch Perch coming out of Scugog this year. It's been a great winter for that lake so far!
Yeah, the only trip I caught walleye on Scugog so far this year has been in the evening.
Thats a nice feed of perch WTG  rob
